message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.SD, cs.CL, cs.AI

This paper focuses on the task of learning a semantic vector space for both spoken and handwritten digits using the TIDIGITs and MNIST datasets. The paper proposes a technique that maps an input to the mean and log variance vectors of a diagonal Gaussian from which sample semantic embeddings are drawn. This technique is related to variational autoencoders (VAEs) and regularization. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning). The paper also deals with image and audio inputs, which suggests that it could belong to cs.CV (Computer Vision) and cs.SD (Sound). The paper also mentions the use of a loss function, which is related to natural language processing (NLP) techniques, suggesting that it could belong to cs.CL (Computation and Language). Finally, the paper discusses the potential for this technique to be applied to other areas of cross-modality/domain information retrieval and transfer learning, which suggests that it could belong to cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence).
